title: NZ Cheesey Scones
abstract:
We love to go to New Zealand to visit our very dear friends and when we are out and about exploring in the quaint little towns that are in the area and stop for a coffee, the cheese scones, found in every café and coffee shop are a definite favourite. 
We just love them and they are now also popular with our kids, once I found a recipe that remotely tasted like the ones we love so much over there!
I make them for lunch and we might eat them plain with butter or add a slice of ham or tomato. 
I call them NZ Cheesy Scones
ingredients:
2 cups plain flour

1 teaspoon sugar
Pinch cayenne
1 cup milk
2 teaspoons baking powder
½ teaspoon salt
2 cups grated tasty cheese
method: Preheat oven to 220ºC and place a baking tray in the oven.
Sift flour, sugar, cayenne, baking powder, salt into a bowl.
Make a well in the centre and add the milk.
Mix quickly with a knife and turn out onto a floured board.
Quickly shape into a 3cm thick (approx.) rectangle and cut into eight squares.
Bake on a floured hot tray for 15-20mins.
